Michael Silverstein wrote:
 >

> With Test Mentor (which among other things discovers and runs JUnit tests)
> we use the JPDA http://java.sun.com/products/jpda/ to dynamically monitor
> method entry events during test execution. 
> 


Vladimir Bossicard wrote:
 >
 > The best way is to use a Profiler. See the JVMPI specification.
 >

JPDA and JVMPI are great if you don't mind changing the JVM command line 
to enable their use.  JPDA also requires that the JIT be disabled, which 
is probably tolerable when exercising test code.  JVMPI still isn't 
stable with a number of JVM versions.

Alternatively, method entry hooks can be dynamically added to methods of 
a class using a byte code engineering package.  This arguably takes a 
bit more work, but it's another option worth considering.  There are 
several open-source packages that lower the barrier to entry, as well.
